Are You Ready for an AI Workshop That Actually Changes How Your Team Works?
A short readiness checklist for businesses considering hands-on AI workshops.
Most AI training fails because it stops at demos. A real workshop changes workflows. Here is the quick readiness checklist I use before we ever open a slide deck.

When teams ask for AI training, what they usually want is speed and confidence. But what they need is a safe way to change how work gets done. That means picking real tasks, not toy examples.

## The three signals that you are ready

1. You can name two repetitive tasks that consume 5+ hours per week.
2. Your team already has a shared system for capturing prompts, templates, or process notes.
3. You have a leader who will sponsor the new workflow after the workshop ends.

## What we build in the room

We start with a short audit, then we pick one workflow that matters. The workshop ends with a working prompt library, a clear review loop, and a simple measurement plan so you can prove the ROI.

If you want to see what this looks like for your team, schedule a consult and I will map the workshop to your exact roles.

Local SEO Quick Wins for New Hampshire Service Businesses
A short list of the highest impact fixes that move rankings without a full site rebuild.
If your business depends on local search, start here. These fixes usually move rankings and calls inside 30 days, even without a redesign.

Local SEO works best when your site, Google Business Profile, and review strategy all tell the same story. The most common wins are simple, but they are rarely done consistently.

## The five upgrades that matter first

- Align your homepage title tag with the exact service + location your customers search.
- Add a dedicated service page for each core offer, not one catch-all list.
- Make your phone number and service area visible above the fold on mobile.
- Use FAQ sections that answer the same questions you get on calls.
- Ask for reviews right after delivery, with a direct link and a short prompt.

If you want a custom audit, book a consult and I will send you a prioritized list.

The five upgrades that matter first
A fast checklist you can run today to see where leads are leaking.
You do not need a full rebuild to get better leads. Run this short audit first and you will know exactly where the leaks are.

Most websites fail at the same steps: unclear value proposition, weak proof, and slow paths to action. You can spot all three in minutes.

## Quick audit steps

1. Ask three people to read your homepage for 10 seconds. Can they explain what you do?
2. Check mobile speed and the first paint time. If it feels slow, it is.
3. Count how many clicks it takes to book a call.
4. Replace generic testimonials with results and specific outcomes.
5. Make the primary CTA the only high-contrast button on the page.

If you want the full conversion teardown, schedule a consult and I will map the fixes to your site.
